details.p: The `Object` type is the root of the runtime type system. Every element that can appear in a scene, be manipulated through scripts, or participate in rendering and logic derives its basic functionality from Object. It establishes the fundamental contract that all other types extend, providing common lifecycle methods, hierarchy management, and component composition.

An `Object` is not tied to a specific visual or logical role by itself. Instead, it serves as a container for components, and these components define the actual capabilities of the instance. Higher-level types such as `Node`, `Node2D`, or `ImageView` are constructed by layering specialized components on top of the base `Object`.

method.name: Clear
method.summary: Clear all children of the object.
method.details: Removes and properly releases all child objects from this object's hierarchy. This operation recursively clears each child object, removes them from the parent-child relationship, unreferences their Lua objects, and sets their parent pointer to NULL. The children list is then cleared. This is a destructive operation that completely empties the object's child hierarchy.

method.name: Release
method.summary: Garbage-collect an object (clear and release).
method.details: Performs complete cleanup and destruction of the object. This includes: clearing all children recursively, removing the object from its parent's children list, clearing game focus/hover references if this object holds them, sending a "Destroy" message, releasing animation libraries, timers, animations, style classes, components, properties, and aliases. Finally frees all allocated memory including SourceFile, TextContent, Name, ClassName, and Xmlns strings. This is the final cleanup method called during garbage collection.

method.name: Equals
method.summary: Compare two objects for equality.
method.details: Compares this object with another object to determine if they represent the same instance. Typically implemented as pointer comparison or unique identifier matching to determine object identity rather than content equality.
method.arg: The second object to compare against this object for equality
method.returns: True if the objects are the same instance, false if they are different objects

method.name: Awake
method.summary: Initializes the core component when it is loaded, an essential lifecycle method.
method.details: Perform setup and dependency wiring here before other logic runs.

method.name: Animate
method.summary: Runs object animations.
method.details: Invokes the animation pipeline for this object and its hierarchy.

method.name: LoadPrefabs
method.summary: Loads and instantiates prefabs.
method.details: Resolves and loads prefab resources for this object tree.

method.name: ProcesEvents
method.summary: Processes pending events.
method.details: Dispatches queued events through the object hierarchy.

method.name: UpdateProperties
method.summary: Updates object properties.
method.details: Applies property changes and recalculates dependent state.

method.name: UpdateLayout
method.summary: Updates object layout.
method.details: Recalculates layout based on current properties and hierarchy.
method.arg: Available width for layout calculations
Available height for layout calculations

method.name: AddChild
method.summary: Add a child object.
method.details: Adds the specified object as a child of this object in the hierarchy. If the child already has a parent, it is first removed from that parent's children list using REMOVE_FROM_LIST. The child is then added to the end of this object's children list and its parent pointer is set to this object. An "Attached" message is sent to the newly added child. If is_template is true, the OF_TEMPLATE flag is set on this object to indicate it contains template children.
method.arg: The child object to add to this object's hierarchy
If true, marks this object with the OF_TEMPLATE flag to indicate it contains template children

method.name: RemoveFromParent
method.summary: Destroys an object.
method.details: Detaches object form it's parent that causes the object to be garbage collected.
method.arg: If set, would remove the entire chain of modal windows, like nested menus

method.name: SetProperty
method.summary: Set a property on the object.
method.details: Sets or updates a named property on this object. If the property doesn't exist, it may be created. If it exists, its value is updated. This method integrates with the Lua property system and may trigger property change callbacks and validation. The property system supports various data types including primitives, vectors, colors, and custom types.
method.arg: The name of the property to set or update
method.returns: True if the property was successfully set, false if the operation failed due to invalid property name, type mismatch, or other constraints

method.name: GetProperty
method.summary: Get a property value from an object.
method.details: Retrieves the current value of the specified property from this object. The method searches through the object's property collection and returns the value if found. If the property doesn't exist, returns nil. This integrates with Lua's property access system and supports all property data types including handles, floats, vectors, colors, integers, booleans, and enumerations.
method.arg: The name of the property whose value to retrieve
method.returns: The current value of the property, or nil if the property doesn't exist. Return type varies based on property data type

method.name: FindChild
method.summary: Find a child object by name.
method.details: Searches for a child object with the specified name. When recursive is false, only searches immediate children. When recursive is true, performs a depth-first search through the entire subtree to find the first object with a matching name. The search compares against the object's Name property using string comparison.
method.arg: The exact name of the child object to locate
If true, searches recursively through all descendants; if false, searches only immediate children
method.returns: Pointer to the first child object found with the matching name, or null if no match is found

method.name: DispatchEvent
method.summary: Dispatch an event starting from this object and bubbling up parents.
method.details: Initiates an event that begins at this object and bubbles up through the parent hierarchy. Each object in the chain has the opportunity to handle the event through registered event handlers or callbacks. The bubbling continues until either an object handles the event or the root of the hierarchy is reached. This implements a standard event propagation pattern commonly used in UI systems.
method.arg: The name of the event to dispatch through the hierarchy
method.returns: Pointer to the object that successfully handled the event, or null if no object in the hierarchy handled it

method.name: Play
method.summary: Play an animation or resource on the object.
method.details: Initiates playback of the specified animation or media resource on this object. The animation name is resolved against the object's animation library or external animation resources. This triggers the animation system to begin updating the object's properties over time according to the animation's keyframes and timeline.
method.arg: Name or identifier of the animation to play, resolved from the object's animation library

method.name: Bind
method.summary: Bind a property of an object to an expression or data source.
method.details: Creates a data binding relationship between a property on this object and a data source expression. The binding automatically updates the property value whenever the source data changes. The expression can reference other object properties, global variables, or computed values. This enables reactive programming patterns where UI elements automatically reflect data model changes.
method.arg: The name of the property on this object to bind to the data source
The binding expression or data source path that will provide values for the property

method.name: SetFocus
method.summary: Set focus on the object.
method.details: Makes this object the currently focused object in the game interface. This triggers focus change events: sends "KillFocus" to the previously focused object (if any) and "SetFocus" to this object. Also posts "ThemeChanged" messages to both objects to update their visual appearance. Updates the game's global focus reference to point to this object.

method.name: DoTween
method.summary: Tween an object property over time.
method.details: Creates and initiates a smooth animation transition (tween) that interpolates an object property from its current value to a target value over a specified duration. Supports various easing functions and animation curves. The tween system handles different property types including scalars, vectors, and colors. Multiple tweens can run simultaneously on different properties of the same object.

method.name: AddStyleSheet
method.summary: Add a stylesheet to the object.
method.details: Attaches a stylesheet resource to this object, enabling CSS-like styling capabilities. The stylesheet contains rules that can modify the appearance and behavior of this object and potentially its children. Stylesheets support selectors, property assignments, and cascading rules. Multiple stylesheets can be applied to the same object, with later sheets taking precedence for conflicting rules.
method.arg: Name or path of the stylesheet resource to load and apply to this object

method.name: SetTimer
method.summary: Set a timer on the object.
method.details: Creates and starts a timer associated with this object. Timers can be one-shot or repeating, and execute callback functions after specified delays or intervals. The timer is automatically cleaned up when the object is destroyed. Multiple timers can be active on the same object simultaneously. Timers integrate with the game's update loop and respect pause states.
method.returns: Handle or identifier for the created timer, which can be used to control or cancel the timer before it expires

method.name: SetContext
method.summary: Set the current context object where newly created objects will be parented.
method.details: Establishes this object as the current creation context in the Lua environment. When new objects are created through Lua scripts without explicitly specifying a parent, they will automatically be added as children of this context object. This provides a convenient way to control object hierarchy during scripted object creation and helps maintain organized scene structures.

method.name: GetName
method.summary: Retrieves the object's name identifier
method.details: Returns the string name assigned to this object instance for identification and lookup purposes.
method.returns: Current name of the object

method.name: SetName
method.summary: Sets the object's name identifier
method.details: Assigns a new name to this object for identification. Names are typically used for hierarchical lookups and debugging.
method.arg: New name to assign to the object

method.name: GetClassName
method.summary: Returns the object's class type name
method.details: Retrieves the runtime type information for this object, useful for type checking and reflection.
method.returns: Class name of the object type

method.name: CheckName
method.summary: Checks if object has a specific name
method.details: Performs name comparison to determine if this object matches the given identifier.
method.arg: Name to check against
method.returns: True if object name matches the provided string

method.name: FindByPath
method.summary: Finds child object by hierarchical path
method.details: Searches through object hierarchy using a path string (e.g., "parent/child/grandchild") to locate nested objects.
method.arg: Hierarchical path to the target object
method.returns: Pointer to found object, or null if not found

method.name: GetStyle
method.summary: Retrieves object style flags
method.details: Returns a bitmask of style flags similar to WinAPI style constants. Each bit represents different visual or behavioral properties.
method.returns: Current style flags as bitmask

method.name: SetStyle
method.summary: Sets object style flags
method.details: Applies a bitmask of style flags to control object appearance and behavior. Flags can be combined using bitwise OR operations like WinAPI styles.
method.arg: Style flags bitmask to apply

method.name: FindCallbackForID
method.summary: Retrieves callback function name for event ID
method.details: Looks up the registered callback function associated with a specific event identifier for event handling.
method.arg: Event ID to find callback for
method.returns: Name of callback function, or empty if none registered

method.name: ApplyStyles
method.summary: Applies style changes to object hierarchy
method.details: Forces style recalculation and application, optionally propagating changes to child objects in the hierarchy.
method.arg: Whether to apply styles to child objects recursively

method.name: SetDirty
method.summary: Sets object dirty and queues it for recalculation
method.details: Marks the object as needing recalculation and updates the timestamp. Dirty objects are processed during the next update cycle to ensure consistent state.

method.name: GetParent
method.summary: Gets the parent object in the hierarchy
method.details: Returns a pointer to the parent object, or null if this is the root object.
method.returns: Pointer to parent object, or null if no parent

method.name: GetFirstChild
method.summary: Gets the first child object
method.details: Returns a pointer to the first child in the object hierarchy, or null if no children exist.
method.returns: Pointer to first child object, or null if no children

method.name: GetNext
method.summary: Gets the next sibling object
method.details: Returns a pointer to the next sibling object at the same hierarchy level, or null if this is the last sibling.
method.returns: Pointer to next sibling object, or null if no next sibling

method.name: GetRoot
method.summary: Gets the root object of the hierarchy
method.details: Traverses up the parent chain to find and return the topmost object in the hierarchy.
method.returns: Pointer to root object

method.name: FindChildByID
method.summary: Finds a child object by its unique identifier
method.details: Searches through child objects to find one matching the specified ID.
method.arg: Unique identifier of the child object to find
method.returns: Pointer to child object with matching ID, or null if not found

method.name: FindChildByAlias
method.summary: Finds a child object by its alias identifier
method.details: Searches through child objects to find one matching the specified alias ID.
method.arg: Alias identifier of the child object to find
method.returns: Pointer to child object with matching alias, or null if not found

method.name: GetSourceFile
method.summary: Gets the source file path
method.details: Returns the file path of the source file from which this object was created or loaded.
method.returns: Path to the source file

method.name: GetTextContent
method.summary: Gets the text content of the object
method.details: Returns the textual content contained within this object, if applicable.
method.returns: Text content of the object

method.name: GetTimestamp
method.summary: Gets the last modified timestamp
method.details: Returns the timestamp of when this object was last marked dirty, indicating the last time it required recalculation.
method.returns: Timestamp of last dirty marking

method.name: GetLuaObject
method.summary: Gets the Lua object reference
method.details: Returns the Lua registry index associated with this object.
method.returns: Lua registry index for the object

method.name: GetAlias
method.summary: Gets the alias identifier
method.details: Returns the alias ID of the object if one is defined.
method.returns: Alias identifier

method.name: GetFlags
method.summary: Gets the object flags
method.details: Returns the bitfield representing the current state of the object.
method.returns: Bitfield of object flags

method.name: SetFlags
method.summary: Sets the object flags
method.details: Updates the bitfield representing the object's state. Only the flags marked as user-settable in the documentation should be modified directly.
method.arg: New bitfield value for the object flags

method.name: GetIdentifier
method.summary: Gets the identifier of the object
method.details: Returns the unique identifier of this object. The identifier is a hash of the object's name and remains stable across sessions for consistent reference.
method.returns: Hashed identifier of the object

method.name: GetModal
method.summary: Gets the modal child object
method.details: Returns a pointer to the modal child object if one is set, or null otherwise. Modal objects are typically used for popup dialogs, menus, or other UI elements that should capture input exclusively.
method.returns: Pointer to the modal child object, or null if no modal is set

method.name: SetModal
method.summary: Sets or clears the modal child object
method.details: Sets a child object as modal, or clears the existing modal by passing null. When set, the previous modal is removed from the parent and the new modal object is attached. The modal object has the OF_NOACTIVATE flag set and its parent pointer is updated. Modal objects are typically used for popups, menus, or dialogs that should capture input.
method.arg: The object to set as modal, or null to clear the current modal

method.name: IsFocused
method.summary: Checks if this object currently has focus
method.details: Returns true if this object is currently the focused object in the game interface, false otherwise. The focused object typically receives keyboard input and visual focus indicators.
method.returns: True if this object has focus, false otherwise

method.name: SetHover
method.summary: Sets the hover state for an object
method.details: Marks this object as the currently hovered object. This is typically called by the input system when the mouse cursor moves over an object.

method.name: SetTextContent
method.summary: Sets the text content of the object
method.details: Updates the text content displayed by this object. This is typically used for text labels, buttons, or other UI elements that display text. The text content is copied internally and can be modified at any time to update the displayed text.
method.arg: The text content to display

method.name: SetSourceFile
method.summary: Sets the source file path of the object
method.details: Associates a source file path with this object, typically used for debugging purposes or to track which file defined the object. This is useful when loading UI elements from external files or templates to maintain a reference to the original source location.
method.arg: The file path to associate with the object

method.name: SetClassName
method.summary: Sets the CSS-style class name of the object
method.details: Assigns a class name to this object, similar to CSS classes in web development. The class name can be used for styling, identification, or querying objects with similar characteristics. This enables flexible categorization and styling of UI elements without relying solely on object types.
method.arg: The class name to assign to the object

method.name: FindParentOfClass
method.summary: Finds the nearest parent object of a specific class
method.details: Traverses up the object hierarchy starting from this object to find the first parent that matches the specified class identifier. This is useful for finding containing elements, such as finding the parent window or panel that contains a button. Returns null if no matching parent is found.
method.arg: The hashed identifier of the class to search for
method.returns: Pointer to the matching parent object, or null if not found

method.name: FindChildOfClass
method.summary: Finds a child object of a specific class
method.details: Searches the children of this object to find the first child that matches the specified class identifier. The search can be recursive depending on implementation. This is useful for locating specific UI elements within a container, such as finding a button within a panel. Returns null if no matching child is found.
method.arg: The hashed identifier of the class to search for
method.returns: Pointer to the matching child object, or null if not found

method.name: IsPrefabView
method.summary: Checks if this object is a prefab view container
method.details: Returns true if this object is a PrefabView, which is a special container that can dynamically load and instantiate different prefab templates based on its source property. Similar to Kanzi's PrefabView, this allows for runtime loading of reusable UI component templates by changing the source string, making it useful for dynamic UI composition and template-based layouts.
method.returns: True if this object is a PrefabView, false otherwise

method.name: AddAlias
method.summary: Registers an alias for a child object path
method.details: Adds a named alias that provides a shorthand reference to a child object path. This is called during the loading phase to register aliases. Once registered, the aliased path can be referenced using the syntax #AliasName/Child/Property instead of the full path Full/Path/Child/Property. Aliases simplify references to frequently accessed objects and make UI definitions more maintainable.
method.arg: The alias name (used as #name in references)
The full path to the object being aliased

method.name: AssignAliases
method.summary: Resolves and assigns all registered aliases for an object
method.details: Called after the loading phase to resolve alias references and assign aliased children to internal structures. This compilation step processes all aliases registered via AddAlias and updates internal pointers to the actual objects referenced by the given path. This ensures that alias references like #AliasName/Child/Property are properly resolved and ready for use at runtime.
method.arg: The path to the object being processed for alias resolution

method.name: ParseClassAttribute
method.summary: Parses and applies multiple class names from a class attribute string
method.details: Parses a space-separated class attribute string, identical to HTML's class attribute (e.g., class="button primary large"). The function splits the string by spaces and adds each class name to the object. This is typically called during XML/markup parsing when processing class="..." attributes, allowing UI elements to be assigned multiple CSS-style classes for styling and identification purposes. Empty strings are ignored.
method.arg: Space-separated class names, as from a class="..." attribute

method.name: SetAnimation
method.summary: Sets the active animation by name
method.details: Looks up an animation by name in the object's animation library and sets it as the current active animation. The animation must have been previously added to the object's library using AddAnimation. If the animation name is not found, the active animation will be set to null.
method.arg: The name of the animation to activate

method.name: GetAnimation
method.summary: Gets the currently active animation
method.details: Returns a pointer to the keyframe animation that is currently set as active for this object, or null if no animation is active. The active animation is set via SetAnimation and selected from the object's animation library.
method.returns: Pointer to the active keyframe animation, or null if none is set

method.name: AddAnimation
method.summary: Adds a keyframe animation to the object's animation library
method.details: Registers a keyframe animation in the object's animation library, making it available for activation via SetAnimation. Multiple animations can be added to an object's library and switched between at runtime. The animation is added to a linked list of animations maintained by the object.
method.arg: The keyframe animation to add to the library

method.name: GetInteger
method.summary: Gets an integer property value by identifier
method.details: Searches the object's properties for a property matching the specified long identifier and returns its value as an integer. The long identifier is a fully qualified property identifier in the form ObjectClass.PropertyName, similar to WPF's dependency property system (e.g., Button.Content, TextBlock.Text). The property must be of type Int, Enum, or Bool to be successfully retrieved. If no matching property is found, or if the property type is incompatible, the fallback value is returned instead.
method.arg: The hashed long identifier "ObjectClass.PropertyName" of the property to retrieve
The value to return if the property is not found or incompatible
method.returns: The property value if found and compatible, otherwise the fallback value

method.name: GetProperties
method.summary: Gets the properties collection
method.details: Returns a pointer to the property collection containing configuration and state data for this object.
method.returns: Pointer to properties collection

method.name: FindPropertyByPath
method.summary: Finds a property by navigating a hierarchical path
method.details: Traverses the object hierarchy following the specified path and returns the property at the end. The path uses forward slashes to navigate through child objects, ending with a property name (e.g., "Child1/Child2/PropertyName"). This allows accessing properties on descendant objects without manually traversing each level. Returns null if any part of the path is not found or if the final element is not a valid property.
method.arg: Slash-separated path to the property (e.g., "Child1/Child2/PropertyName")
method.returns: Pointer to the property if found, or null if the path is invalid

function.name: GetFocus
function.returns: Pointer to the currently focused object, or null if no object has focus

function.name: GetHover
function.details: Returns a pointer to the object that is currently being hovered over by the mouse cursor. Returns null if no object is being hovered.
function.returns: Pointer to the object under the mouse cursor, or null if no object is being hovered

enums.name: DataType
enums.summary: Specifies the underlying data type of a property.
enums.details: DataType defines the fundamental type of value a property can hold, ranging from basic primitives like Bool and Float to complex structures such as Transform3D or custom Objects. It helps the engine interpret, validate, and serialize property values appropriately.
enums.enum: No data type specified.
Boolean value representing true or false.
Signed integer value.
Enumeration type represented by integer values mapped to named constants.
Floating-point numeric value.
Two-dimensional vector, typically used for coordinates or sizes.
Three-dimensional vector, used for spatial coordinates, directions, or RGB values.
Four-dimensional vector, commonly used for extended color or transformation data.
2x2 matrix, typically used for simple affine transformations in 2D space.
3x3 matrix, used for 3D affine transformations or rotation data.
2D transformation structure combining position, scale, and rotation.
3D transformation structure combining translation, rotation, and scaling.
Fixed-length string or symbolic value.
Extended string data, intended for larger text content.
Color value defined by RGBA components.
Set of edge-specific values (e.g., margin, padding, or border widths).
List of tag identifiers associated with an object.
Event reference used to bind triggers or callbacks.
Reference to a complex object instance.
Logical grouping of related properties or child elements.

component.name: PropertyType
component.summary: Defines a custom property type that can be attached to engine objects.
component.details: PropertyType allows defining additional data fields beyond built-in engine properties. Each PropertyType specifies its data category, default value, and behavioral attributes such as layout and render impact. It serves as a flexible mechanism for extending object metadata in projects.
component.property: Organizational category for this property, used for grouping in editors and UIs.
Underlying data type that determines how the property value is interpreted and stored.
Default value assigned when the property is not explicitly set.
Type of object or component this property applies to.
Indicates whether this property affects element layout (e.g., size or alignment).
Indicates whether this property influences the rendering output.
If true, the property value cannot be modified at runtime or through the editor.
If true, the property is excluded from the UI or inspector views.
Specifies whether the property value can be inherited from parent components.
Internal key name used for property identification and lookup.
Runtime value stored in this property instance.
Increment step used for numeric adjustments in UI controls.
Maximum allowed value for numeric properties.
Minimum allowed value for numeric properties.
component.field: Internal descriptor structure providing extended property metadata.
